gov.usgs.anss.util

Class Show

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.util.Show

  • public class Show
extends java.lang.Object
    Show.java Tool for displaying Swing demos. This class takes a JPanel, width and hieth and Displays it on the screen in a created JFrame. The Title of the JFrame is the class of the JPanel. A window listener is added so that appropriate clicks make the JFrame exit.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Show() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static javax.swing.JFrame getJFrame()
      get the JFrame associated with this Show object.
      static void inFrame(javax.swing.JPanel jpin, int width, int height)
      this static method takes an JPanel puts it on a new JFrame, sets the title of the JFrame, adds a WindowListener to do exit handling on mouse clicks, and makes the JFrame visible.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • inFrame

        public static void inFrame(javax.swing.JPanel jpin,
           int width,
           int height)
        this static method takes an JPanel puts it on a new JFrame, sets the title of the JFrame, adds a WindowListener to do exit handling on mouse clicks, and makes the JFrame visible. Only on JPanel can be asssociated with a Show so this this is mainly used to unit test JPanels within the GUI by doing a
        Show.inFrame(new LocationPanel(), 600,450);
        Parameters:
        jpin - JPanel to display
        width - Width of the desired JFrame in pixels
        height - Height of the desired JFrame in pixels.

      • getJFrame

        public static javax.swing.JFrame getJFrame()
        get the JFrame associated with this Show object.
        Returns:
        The JFrame associated with this instance.
